p: Sequencing the SARS-CoV2 genome in February 2020 ( 32) showed that phylogenetically it belongs to the genus Betacoronavirus, subgenus Sarbecovirus, and has closer genetic similarity to SARS-CoV than MERS-CoV. The genome consists of a single, positive-stranded RNA with ~30 k (29,811) nucleotides; from these only 5 nucleotides were found to be different between SARS-CoV2 and SARS-CoV. Similar sequencing results (>99.9% similarity) were obtained by different teams on different patient samples ( 33, 34): GenBank sequences MN988668, NC_045512, MN938384.1, MN975262.1, MN985325.1 and MN994468.1.
